byline.contributor: Mark Landler and Matt Apuzzo reported from Washington, and Amy Chozick from New York. Chad Abraham contributed reporting from Aspen, Colo.
byline.original: By MARK LANDLER, MATT APUZZO and AMY CHOZICK

abstract: Atty Gen Loretta E Lynch says she will defer to whatever recommendations career prosecutors and FBI director James Comey make about whether to bring charges in case concerning Hillary Clinton's use of personal email account while she was secretary of state; statement is concession that airport meeting Lynch had with former Pres Bill Clinton could be seen as constituting conflict of interest for her in any decision regarding investigation.
lead_paragraph: The move by Attorney General Loretta E. Lynch would eliminate the possibility that a political appointee would overrule investigators.

headline.main: Loretta Lynch to Accept F.B.I. Recommendations in Clinton Email Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Lynch Will Defer on Bringing Case Against Clinton

snippet: The move by Attorney General Loretta E. Lynch would eliminate the possibility that a political appointee would overrule investigators....
